data.title: Advanced String format with named/numbered parameters
Rename the .zip extension used for project data export in "Export ZIP" mode
data.body:
The `.zip` extension used by the project data export can be confusing for end-users, since they may think they have to extract the file in order to play the project.

What about going back to the `.pcz` extension?

data.title: Fix wrong return bool, string, string array data through jni
Add new Camera2D alignment functions
data.body:
**`reset_smoothing()`** to immediately set the Camera2D's position to the destination point where it is smoothing to. This has only an effect if smoothing is enabled.

**`align()`** to align the camera's position to the tracked Node. (e.g. if anchor mode is set to DRAG_CENTER, it will center the Node). This function does **not** reset smoothing, so if you want to realign the camera immediately, you have to call `align()` and `reset_smoothing()` afterwards.

data.title: RichTextLabel-get_text
data.body: Add support to get the raw text without formatting information from a RichTextLabel

data.title: Can't switch to other views (2D, 3D, Script and AssetLib buttons not working)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux
Pulled the newest git version this morning.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
After compiling the newest updates it seems I can't switch to other views, like 2D and Script. When I start up godot it opens a project from the project manager, but then shows me the 3D view by default even though I am working in 2D. When I go to press the 2D button, it remains pressed until I click it again, as is the case with the other buttons. I have tried with all my projects and I still get this error.

data.body:

i'm working with 2 fullhd external monitors and retina display

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
when project is run content is not scaled properly
after resizing the window it updates and works ok from then 

you can observe it when launching godot (or any sample)

![after any window resize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1180857/16450156/cfb2a6e2-3dfb-11e6-8477-49e8d4977ec8.png)

this issue doesn't occur on the same non-stream 64-bit version of godot

data.title: Gridmap fails to join navmeshes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Xubuntu 16.04 64b - Godot Engine V2.1 alpha custom_build (latest from today 06/29/16)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The MeshLibrary I created for my GridMap contains one tile with a navmesh but the cells in the Gridmap don't join together. When I try to calculate a path, no path was found when the end point is in another cell than the start point. Within the same cell, the path is found.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download the blend file from the link
2. Export it as better collada (last git version). Lights are not needed.
3. Import it in a godot project. (animation not needed)
4. Convert the scene to a MeshLibrary
5. Create a scene with a Navigation node and a child node GridMap using the MeshLibrary. Draw some path. 
6. Add a script that calculates a path:
   `
   
   ```
   extends Spatial
   
   func _update_path():
      var nav=get_node("nav") # navigation node
      var begin=Vector3(0.5,0.5,0.5) #start point
      var end=Vector3(10,0.5,0.5) # end point
   
      var p = nav.get_simple_path(begin,end,true)
      print(p) # should not be empty when a path is found. 
   
   func _ready():
      _update_path()
   ```

`

If the begin and end point are within the same cell, the path is found. But not when they go across two or more cells. Therefore the join of the navmesh didn't occure.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Link to blend file:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B3WfGYr6k_DGUlpXcE5PQXFzRmM/view?usp=sharing
Link to Collada file (exported from blend file):
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B3WfGYr6k_DGWlRMdThDLXpPa1E/view?usp=sharing

data.title: Made Better Collada Exporter flake8-compliant
data.body:
The only thing I did not fix is the unused local variables because perhaps they were there for some reason, but those can be removed as well if that's not a concern.

Next changes should probably be:
- Use os.path.join instead of `... + "/" + ...`
- Use string formatting instead of string concatenation
- Use xml.etree.ElementTree instead of manually outputting XML 

I release all the changes in this PR under both the MIT license and the GPLv2 or later.

data.title: Initialize missing variables. Fixes #5461
2D Default Gravity Vector - X component not working. (not loaded properly?)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, 64 bit. Tried with 2.0.3 stable official, and recent June builds. 

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If I set the default gravity vector in Project Settings >> Physics 2d to have any non-zero x component, it does not function when I play the game. The gravity in y works, but nothing in x. Actually it worked right once, but that's never happened again it at least a dozen tries. When the editor is restarted, the x component is reset to zero. However, if I open the engine.cfg file in a text editor, it seems to have the correct values:  "[physics_2d]default_gravity_vector=Vector2(0.17, 0.26)" or whatever.

data.title: Ability to duplicate arrays/dictionaries directly.
data.body:
During an IRC conversation it was noted there is no straightforward way to easily make copies of arrays and dictionaries. It'd be a great feature to have, something like var mydictcopy = mydict.duplicate() (and likewise for arrays) or something similar to that.

Someone noted mydictcopy = Dictionary(mydict) produces a valid copy, but he described it as a bug, so it doesn't sound like a reliable method, unless we can ensure this behavior will be preserved.

data.title: Getters/setters for `export`ed variables aren't called in `tool` mode
data.body:
I'm not sure if that woud break somehow the design philosophy of Godot, so I'm opening it to discuss if that would be a good addition.

Maybe opening that possibility would encourage a lot of undesired mixing of editor/runtime code in scripts, but `tool` probably already does and this would just enhance its usefulness.

data.title: Starred project are not saved in project manager
In the project manager, favorites are not remembered after quitting
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Arch Linux 64-bit - Git commit https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/5065e46381814746eeddb4c44b5eb1540b0331f8, compiled with Clang 3.8.0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): In the project manager, favorites are not remembered after quitting.

**Steps to reproduce:** Mark one or several projects as favorite in the project manager, open the editor, quit it and restart the project manager. The favorites are gone.

data.title: itemlist-get_selected_items
data.body: Adding a method to list the selected indexes of a ItemList, as requested on #5456.

data.title: Enhance/tidy file extensions management
data.body:
NOTE: By now I'm keeping separate commits to keep my work clearer to follow step by step as this is an intrincate topic.

Motivated by [this commit and comment](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/29177e1e9b2644cfa2d5efe6fcfe2605b84ed68c) I decided to have a look. Done the folliowing:
- Reverted reduz's commit.
- Homogenizied loaders/savers because classes for text formats were confusingly named and stored in directories as if they were only for scenes, when they are for resources as well. Special treatment was misleading.
- Removed pointless code that skipped  **.res** extension and then added it expicitly.
- Removed a left-over commented line of code that will never be needed.
- Switched the order in which types are registered so that all text formats are registered before all binary formats. **As a consequence save dialogs will prefer text formats in every case (scenes & resources)** as they pick the first extension in the list for the proposed file name. I think saving resources in text is also desired for the same reasons as scenes.
